div.div: üî• refactor(invoice.py, payment_method.py, client_model.py, invoice_model.py, product_model.py): remove unused imports This commit removes unused imports from the files listed above. This improves the code's readability and reduces the amount of memory used by the application.

üêõ fix(product_model.py): update query to include name and category fields üîí chore(admin.html): disable assign team button The product_model.py file has been updated to include the name and category fields in the query. This ensures that the name and category fields are updated when the update method is called.
The admin.html file has been updated to disable the assign team button. This is because the feature is not yet implemented and the button should not be clickable until it is.

üé® style(index.css): adjust form and table width The width of the form and table elements were adjusted to 74.5rem to improve the layout of the page.
üêõ fix(client_model.py): add proj_status to client model The proj_status attribute was added to the Client model to match the corresponding column in the database.
üêõ fix(invoice_model.py): fix update_invoice query syntax The update_invoice query syntax was fixed by removing the extra comma after the amount parameter.
‚ú® feat(product_model.py): add update_product_status method The update_product_status method was added to the Product model to update the status of a product in the database.
üêõ fix(product.py): update product status in update_product_status method The update_product_status method in the Product controller was updated to update the status of a product in the database.
üêõ fix(client_products.html): update proj_status to status The proj_status attribute was updated

üé® style(index.css): add hover effect to .btn-danger class üöö chore(admin.html): remove Invoice column and replace Product Details button with Contact button The .btn-danger class now has a hover effect that changes the background color and text color. The Invoice column was removed from the admin.html table and replaced with a Contact button that links to the client's email address. This change improves the user experience by providing a more direct way to contact clients.

üé® style(css): update styling for consistency and responsiveness This commit updates the styling of several pages to improve consistency and responsiveness. The changes include: - Adding a new class to the main body of the index.css file to improve responsiveness - Updating the styling of links and buttons to improve consistency - Updating the styling of the table in the checkout_page.html file to improve responsiveness - Adding a new button to the admin.html file to allow for easy email contact with employees - Updating the container class in several html files to improve responsiveness
üé® style(client_products.html, client_update_password.html, display_all_products.html, employee_home.html, employee_login.html, employee_update_password.html, index.html): add margin auto to container class The container class now has a margin auto property, which centers the content of the page. This improves the visual appearance of the pages and makes them more user-friendly. The buttons have also been updated to use the NES.css library, which provides a more modern and consistent look and feel.

üêõ fix(admin.py): use title() instead of capitalize() for product name ‚ú® feat(product.py): update get_current_product_by_client method in Invoice model üî® refactor(client_model.py): remove proj_status from get_invoices_by_client method üî® refactor(invoice_model.py): remove proj_status from update_invoice method üî® refactor(product_model.py): add status field to Product model The product name is now properly capitalized using the title() method instead of capitalize(). The get_current_product_by_client method in the Invoice model has been updated to return the current product by client. The proj_status field has been removed from the get_invoices_by_client and update_invoice methods in the Client and Invoice models, respectively. The Product model has been updated to include a status field.
üé® style(client_products.html): reformat table headers and rows üíÑ style(client_products.html): change invoice details modal title to include product name The table headers and rows have been reformatted to better display the product name and price. The invoice details modal title has been updated to include the product name for better clarity.

üîí chore(client_model.py): add password field to INSERT query üêõ fix(invoice_model.py): simplify conditional statement The client model now includes a password field in the INSERT query, which is necessary for authentication purposes. The invoice model's conditional statement has been simplified to check if the results exist instead of checking if the length of the results is greater than 0.

üêõ fix(client.py): use the correct variable name for client id üêõ fix(product.py): import the correct model for invoices ‚ú® feat(client_model.py): add method to get invoices by client ‚ú® feat(invoice_model.py): add proj_status to the insert and update queries The variable name for the client id was incorrect, so it was changed to the correct name. The incorrect model was being imported for invoices, so it was changed to the correct model. A new method was added to the client model to get invoices by client. The insert and update queries in the invoice model were updated to include the proj_status field.
üî• refactor(product_model.py): remove status attribute from Product class and related queries üî• refactor(admin.html, client_products.html): remove status column from tables ‚ú® feat(product_model.py, client_products.html): add invoice functionality The status attribute was removed from the Product class and related queries as it was not being used. The status column was also removed from the admin and client products tables as it was no longer needed. The invoice functionality was added to the client products page, allowing clients to update the details of their invoices.

üîç chore(admin): add support for active employees ‚ú® feat(employee_model.py): add get_active_employees method The admin page now displays a list of active employees instead of all employees. The get_active_employees method was added to the Employee class to retrieve all employees that have been updated. This allows the admin to see only the employees that have been recently updated.
